titleStmt.title: Charles J. Bushnell to James W. Tate
CWG2667

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
James W. Tate Esq
Asst. Secy. of State,
Frankfort,
Ky.
New=York, Jany 30th 1862.
Dear Sir,

Enclosed herewith, I send you my oath of office, as Commissioner of Deeds in this city for the Commonwealth of Kentucky, together with the State tax of Five Dollars as mentioned in yours of the 15th inst.
A severe attack of sickness has prevented my replying to you before.
Please present my thanks to His Excellency, Gov. Magoffin, for the renewal of my Commission, and believe me to be,

Dear Sir,
Very Respectfully,
Your Obt Servt

Chas. J. Bushnell
Atty. at Law.
No 413 Fourth Avenue, near 29th St.
N.Y. City.

State of New=York.
City & County of New=York. } ss.

I, Charles J. Bushnell, residing in the City, County, and state aforesiad, appointed by the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, a commissioner in the said state of New=York, to administer oaths and affirmations, and to take depositions, affidavits and the acknowledgment and proof of deeds &c to be used or recorded in the said Commonwealth of Kentucky, do solemnly swear "well and truly to execute and perform all the duties of said commissioner."
Taken and Subscribed this 29th day of January, A.D. 1862, -- Before me,
A Notary Public for the State of New York, duly commissioned & sworn, residing in the city of New_York, and duly authorized by law to administer oaths.

New York
Comr of Deeds
Chas. J. Bushnell
Filed Feby 4 1862
